document.title: WIDA English Language Development Standards Framework 2020

05A1FB6D3F8741A78FC298B52E08D9D5.description:
Show relationships between claims and
counterclaims, differences in perspectives,
and evidence and reasoning

9C2FB9F97B90491BB088DED0E6C46B74.description:
Select relevant information to support
claims with evidence gathered from
multiple sources

00C09B10CA0342B5BCA29263C1F688FA.description:
Evaluating point of view and credibility of
source based on relevance and intended
use

93BC59C61B5844B9AE6B2743D9669192.description:
Analyzing relevant information from
multiple sources to support claims

F8FE788F399D4D50822DA59AB22E005E.description:
Identifying topic and purpose (argue
in favor or against a position, present
a balanced interpretation, challenge
perspective)

48BE9643FC6F4567AFD26C7C9F4411FF.description:
Generalize multiple causes and effects of
developments or events

8CC50595518A49E8A0DE08A5D7880962.description:
Develop reasoning, sequences with linear
and nonlinear relationships, evidence,
and details, acknowledging strengths and
weaknesses

F6128285D15940E08A8A262D57566988.description:
Establish perspective for communicating
outcomes, consequences, or
documentation

86F6DFE9FCA04A0BB52A7EF917912FB2.description:
Introduce and contextualize phenomena or
events

13D741F170FA4DC1AE50D87AF0B9A2A9.description:
Evaluate experts’ points of agreement,
along with strengths and weakness of
explanations

9CC161E72EA14A4589DD5FA5883E88C3.description:
Analyzing sources for logical relationships
among contributing factors or causes

23AF66CE4C364BF0A3DEFB1608AA37E9.description:
Determining multiple points of view in
sources for answering compelling and
supporting questions about phenomena or
events

073D3D0253A34B17814447A15382F53E.description:
Signal logical relationships among
reasoning, evidence, data, and/or a model
when making or defending a claim or
counterclaim

B02975C1CC3C433E8E64FA8F8CD72C8A.description:
Establish and maintain a neutral or
objective stance

D65D25DA14674CD786CF186219090B8E.description:
Support or refute a claim based on data
and evidence

3FF9A1A1CEBA4F9BBC2BF153A470CDD4.description:
Introduce and contextualize topic/
phenomenon in issues related to the natural
and designed world(s)

74992EA90B604AF989156DE9A2C653E6.description:
Evaluating whether they emphasize similar
or different evidence and/or interpretations
of facts

422D66714BD34777BAF2F59B7916FE2C.description:
Comparing reasoning and claims based on
evidence from two arguments on the same
topic

ADFA13EF691B4FE899691E765778B2C5.description:
Identifying convincing evidence from
data, models, and/or information from
investigations of phenomena or design
solutions

52BE3F278D32403EBE199FEAF8FD80F5.description:
Summarize patterns in evidence, making
trade-offs, revising, and retesting

C8E4B945E2844993878750B26026946F.description:
Develop reasoning to show relationships
among independent and dependent
variables in models and simple systems

1059992E7A3C4FDF85B6E25B95CF4FCC.description:
Establish neutral or objective stance in how
results are communicated

4E8447413FE74FB49E5CBA2A7A28FD36.description:
Describe valid and reliable evidence from
sources about a phenomenon

481EA059A9684130B0EEC6A4648CEAC1.description:
Evaluating scientific reasoning that shows
why data or evidence adequately supports
conclusions

6AAA1FBFE1DD4A9083DFDAC521369A48.description:
Determining central ideas in complex
evidence and information to help explain
how or why a phenomenon occurs

5A971BC1553A4A2A852D4AC5D703BCCE.description:
Defining investigable questions or
design problems based on observations,
information, and/or data about a
phenomenon

2662837CC2EE439288E06BD55C9C94B9.description:
Justify conclusions with evidence and
mathematical facts

532CD62768484702B76BA49A9D74A8D2.description:
Create conjecture, using definitions and
previously established results

51C6102C75FD4C38BE9AA2AD71242E86.description:
Evaluating relationships between
evidence and mathematical facts to create
generalizations

CE9A183747B24C5CB0AE1A27DA834202.description:
Comparing conjectures with previously
established results

FD5074EC18084FB0BF62DFA40F165914.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

AF8BED3E7CCB467998105F5F15667B52.description:
Evaluating model and rationale for
underlying relationships in selected
problem-solving approach

26D1426BB9D74A3A8E64F71D8DFDB177.description:
Analyzing possible ways to represent and
solve a problem

E48490027C20455AA32D7155598B90D6.description:
Logically organize claim(s) with clear reasons
and relevant evidence; offer a conclusion

4F857C2C29E6450995A46ECD54BD3C33.description:
Support claims with reasons and evidence that
are clear, relevant, and credible

E25E206536F841EBA1588F61E70D9016.description:
Introduce and develop claim(s) and
acknowledge counterclaim(s)

5051B2CC983B4A5294F5D9D7BCA7A87C.description:
Evaluating relevance, sufficiency of
evidence, and validity of reasoning that
support claim(s)

F9F1B1B4D8FA413CB95E5E22BB3BDB34.description:
Analyzing how an author
acknowledges and responds to
conflicting evidence or viewpoints

4DE7E91F659F4A7DB66DBA94039632F0.description:
Identifying and summarizing central
idea distinct from prior knowledge or
opinions

9EA8476689414A168E636E9E162C43D7.description:
Develop coherence and cohesion throughout
text

6FD01A0DF18743B6BE94E6D77C8A4862.description:
Add precision, details, and clarity about
relevant attributes, qualities, characteristics,
activities, and behaviors

59B7F5C8867543E4998F6D81EC7C8352.description:
Introduce and define topic and/or entity for
audience

EF4C49B674B2492592A615DCEF805B83.description: Construct informational texts in language arts that

75D855B86C44443EA863BA6BD7FD7A38.description:
Evaluating the impact of author’s key
word choices over the course of a text

4561ADFD303F45BEABF53E2B8B155C2C.description:
Analyzing observations and
descriptions in textual evidence for
key attributes, qualities, characteristics,
activities, and behaviors

0467C78D0B1D4B378B9C31986EBD2CC0.description:
Identifying and/or summarizing
main ideas and their relationship to
supporting ideas

EC88E1C27DB34C82B5A477F77BFFB402.description:
Interpret informational texts in language
arts by

8F7D47EB2F63425AB920020FCA275C12.description: Develop story, including themes with complication and resolution, time, and event sequences

0C3AB00F8BE944C0B1A62C41CA4ACC4F.description: Develop and describe characters and their relationships

905DA656634D4D2C9762531694C91F82.description: Orient audience to context and point of view

B5D827AD2AA845138BC9C74646C10F96.description: Evaluating impact of specific word choices about meaning and tone

03E83B4939B64D228FA64FC5919FB433.description: Analyzing how character attributes and actions develop in relation to events or dialogue

DAEC483E0D3143B081A8522D65081458.description: Identifying a theme or central idea that develops over the course of a text

BAF5AE4F9BD647DDBFA9D6BF3E7772A7.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

4940C41756D1458C9FFD7B54CA5C9C1F.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

D26BDACBEBFD4CA286D7B9274FE30151.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

02ACEC35D734469C93FBAAC05BF7AC25.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

E7F44BE6A2344E91A7665FFCAE6ED07C.description: Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular ways

3F9E014FC6374488AE96D33197F82A61.description: Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular outcomes

DFEE4847605D4626ABBDAFF54879B4AB.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

82F41BB0A1A143369292A59CFEA4DE30.description: Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and effects

D753C58F86AF4E2B81115A4F36B9F565.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

0AAFEE5548A3427BA75215257B48A336.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

05F1B16B98C2481499C0F25BB5632BED.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

D3F72DE1A67E4392BF985E65BC2C9ABA.description: Define and classify facts and interpretations; determine what is known vs. unknown

8BAD035DB0884901B42AC824CA55F444.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

63DC5C86E46D40C9907F84C6A74A5670.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

FA59D82D48EB48CC8D1618F61DE8DB44.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

80DCFD5FCB96491393ED893157ABA838.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

45ED5D079B8149F0AF87E0C58F4148E1.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
